I'm glad to help you out. Here's a sample script for appointment setting, which incorporates strategies used by Jordan Belfort, also known as the "Wolf of Wall Street":

Opening:

"Hello, my name is [Your Name] and I'm calling on behalf of [Company Name]. We specialize in commercial cleaning services and I was wondering if I could speak with the person in charge of your facility's cleaning needs."

Building Rapport:

"I understand that you're busy and I'll be quick. I've been in the industry for a while and I've noticed that many businesses like yours are not getting the level of service they deserve. I just wanted to know if you're happy with your current cleaning service."

Pain Point:

"I'm sure you're aware of the importance of maintaining a clean and healthy work environment for your employees and clients. But did you know that a dirty facility can also negatively impact your image and reputation? And that's not even considering the potential health hazards that come with dirty facilities."

Benefit:

"We understand the importance of keeping your facility clean and we're here to help. We offer a range of commercial cleaning services that are tailored to your specific needs and budget. Our team is fully trained and equipped to handle any cleaning challenge."

Call to Action:

"I'd like to schedule a free quote and consultation with you at your earliest convenience. Would you be available for a call next [day and time]? If not, I can also schedule an appointment for a different day and time that works for you."

Closing:

"Great, I'll make sure to schedule that for you. Thank you for your time, and I look forward to speaking with you soon. Have a good day."

This script incorporates several key strategies used by Jordan Belfort, such as building rapport, identifying pain points, and highlighting the benefits of your service. It also includes a clear call to action, which encourages the prospect to schedule an appointment with you. Remember to always be professional, friendly, and persistent when making cold calls, and always be prepared to answer any questions or objections that the prospect may have.
